page.title: 13ROWDEN FARM SHEBBEAR.
page.content: Three adults and one child live here. There is approx. 150 acres of which 15 are rented. 50 acres are arable, mainly barley. The rest is grassland, mainly permanent pasture. The main enterprise is sheep with a flock of 4oo ewes of Suffolk or Texel crosses. The ewes lamb indoors between January and March. Lambs are sold to the local abbatoir at Torrington. There are 20 head of beef cattle and 2 Hereford bulls that are hired to local dairy farmers. No permanent staff are employed but temporary help is obtained for lambing and harvesting. Contractors are used for ploughing, silage and combining. Redundant farm buildings have been converted into a granny flat.
